channel.title: [PI] Run and Autocast
channel.description:
Hey guys When I run, the run stays @ 100, I tried with a normal char a donator and an owner. Where do I fix that?
And there is no autocast, I tried to add it. It shows the autocast button but when I click on it nothing happens. It seems like the server have it but its somehow disables. Any clue?

item.title: [PI] Run and Autocast
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“amiroslo, post:6, topic:544507”]I cant find it, it was days ago

I mean, I can see the autocast option, but when I click it, nothing happens.

I have this tho

public class client extends RSApplet {
	public Sprite magicAuto;
	public boolean Autocast = false;
	public int autocastId = 0;

and this

else if(s.endsWith(":resetautocast:")) { Autocast = false; autocastId = 0; magicAuto.drawSprite(1000, 1000); [/quote]
What the hell…
Why would you even handle it that way?
drawing a sprite at 1000, 1000 doesn’t remove it, it just changes the location… smh.

Read full topic

item.title: [PI] Run and Autocast

I cant find it, it was days ago

public class client extends RSApplet {
	public Sprite magicAuto;
	public boolean Autocast = false;
	public int autocastId = 0;

and this

else if(s.endsWith(":resetautocast:")) {
						Autocast = false;
						autocastId = 0;
						magicAuto.drawSprite(1000, 1000);

item.title: [PI] Run and Autocast
item.dc:creator: @Driman_Rune Driman Rune
item.description:
@Driman_Rune wrote:

[quote=“amiroslo, post:4, topic:544507”]Im new to this, where should I add this again? :PP

2- I dont think so, I followed a tut but it didnt work ;/[/quote]

Don’t add that, that’s not going to work!

What do you mean it didn’t work? Post the tutorial please.

Read full topic

item.title: [PI] Run and Autocast
item.dc:creator: @amiroslo amiroslo
item.description:
@amiroslo wrote:

[quote=“Terraforming, post:2, topic:544507”]1- It’s not added, or not fully implemented. I doubt it’ll be implemented, so add it in. Something along the lines of…

[CODE=JAVA]
private int runEnergy;

public int getRunEnergy() {
return runEnergy;
}

public void setRunEnergy(int runEnergy) {
this.runEnergy = runEnergy;
}

/*

  • Just a basic example.
    */
    public int dropEnergy(Player player) {
    if (player.runEnergy < 0)
    player.runEnergy = 0;
    else if (player.runEnergy > 100)
    player.runEnergy = 100;
    player.runEnergy = player.runEnergy - 1;
    return runEnergy;
    }
    [/CODE]

2- Did you try adding functions to that interface button?[/quote]

Im new to this, where should I add this again? :PP

2- I dont think so, I followed a tut but it didnt work ;/

Read full topic

item.title: [PI] Run and Autocast
item.dc:creator: @Terraforming Terraforming
item.description:
@Terraforming wrote:

1- It’s not added, or not fully implemented. I doubt it’ll be implemented, so add it in. Something along the lines of…

[CODE=JAVA]
private int runEnergy;

public int getRunEnergy() {
return runEnergy;
}

public void setRunEnergy(int runEnergy) {
this.runEnergy = runEnergy;
}

/*

  • Just a basic example.
    */
    public int dropEnergy(Player player) {
    if (player.runEnergy < 0)
    player.runEnergy = 0;
    else if (player.runEnergy > 100)
    player.runEnergy = 100;
    player.runEnergy = player.runEnergy - 1;
    return runEnergy;
    }
    [/CODE]

2- Did you try adding functions to that interface button?
